entry.title: New Year‚Äôs Resolutions
entry.summary:
Author: Tubagirl

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,841Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Eddie makes a New Year‚Äôs Resolution to tell Evan Buckley he loves him. But when Buck comes home devastated after a hard shift, Eddie‚Äôs only thought is to look after him.But Buck has made a resolution of his own.‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîEddie hated shifts Buck worked without him. They were a team, meant to work side by side, to have each other‚Äôs backs. Buck was Eddie‚Äôs partner, his best friend and, Eddie had come to realise, the person he was in love with. At midnight, as he‚Äôd hugged Chris and they welcomed in the New Year, Eddie had made a resolution, the first since he‚Äôd been a kid.He was going to tell Buck how he felt. Today.Eddie was going to tell this brave, beautiful, caring, ridiculous man that he loved him. That he wanted everything with Buck, and wanted to give everything to Buck. He knew it was a risk, that Buck may not feel the same, but Eddie wasn‚Äôt going to hide any more.That had been the plan, anyway.Right now, though, all Eddie could focus on was that Buck was hurting and needed comfort.

Author: numberonehangsterfan

During USC's annual rivalry game against the Notre Dame Fighting Irish, a particularly hard tackle sends Buck flying out of bounds and straight into the other team. entry.title: i keep on waiting for a sign
entry.summary:
Author: a_colourful_stranger

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,444Chapters: 1/10Kudos: 15

Summary: It‚Äôs a firetruck. His eyes burst open, his vision blurry with tears but he sees the red engine speed past. For a second, his heart stops and he imagines the 118 written on the side of the engine but he blinks and sees 136. He wonders what the call is - is it for a fire or for a medical emergency. He imagines helping them, stepping in and being able to save the day - it‚Äôs silly, he hasn‚Äôt been a firefighter for six years.¬†Another siren goes past and it‚Äôs the 136‚Äôs ambulance, tailing close behind the engine. Buck pictures Chimney and Hen inside. Are they even at the 118 anymore? Is Eddie?Or: Buck's visiting LA after six years away with his girlfriend when he finally finds the sign he didn't know he'd been waiting for.

He says it‚Äôs really cool. I got beer.‚Äù Which was nice because he don‚Äôt have internet or anything to drink but some good ol tap water. ‚ÄúYeah sure. I‚Äôd love to.‚Äù He says trying to stay calm but I‚Äôm so excited I haven‚Äôt watched tv in who knows how long. ‚ÄúWhen do you want me to head over?‚Äù He asks with a huge smile over the phone. He‚Äôs not sure why he‚Äôs so excited, maybe it‚Äôs because he gets to see them, maybe he‚Äôs because Eddie has internet, maybe its because he has more then tap water (which is just gross) to drink. entry.summary:
Author: Surakian

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,741Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 33

Summary: Suddenly, a loud chorus of ‚ÄúHappy New Year‚Äù and the loud popping of fireworks fills the air, signaling the shift to 2020. Between one bright flash to the next, Eddie places his hand on Buck‚Äôs cheek and leans in, gently pressing his lips against Buck‚Äôs. Buck‚Äôs heart is hammering in his chest and his stomach flutters at the soft contact of their lips. It‚Äôs just Eddie‚Äîhe didn‚Äôt think‚Äîcouldn‚Äôt imagine‚Ä¶Why would he have ever considered kissing Eddie would feel like this? It had all been just a silly joke. And yet Buck thinks maybe he should known.Buck and Eddie spend New Year's Eve together at a rooftop bar, and Buck thinks about how he wishes he could get a New Year's kiss. Eddie offers. entry.title: let me drown in your laughter (let me die in your arms)
entry.summary:
Author: karatekid1018

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,248Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 126

Summary: For a moment, Eddie is quiet. He stares. Blinks. Stares some more, his mouth opening and closing around nothing. And then all at once, he zeroes in on the photo collage across the room, and his body goes completely still. They‚Äôre all couples. Happy, blissful, newly married couples, still in their suits and long white dresses, holding each other close beneath the familiar branches of a willow tree. The same branches billowing in the wind outside Eddie‚Äôs bedroom window. A wedding venue. He woke up in a wedding venue. His wedding venue. or: Eddie wakes up on the morning of his and Buck‚Äôs wedding. Except, Eddie is straight, and him and Buck aren‚Äôt together.
